  17. (* The trace *)

  19. open Trace

  21. external current_environment: unit -> Obj.t = "caml_get_current_environment"

  23. ‌let tracing_function_ptr =
  24.   get_code_pointer
  25.     (Obj.repr (fun arg -> Trace.print_trace (current_environment()) arg))

  27. let dir_trace ppf lid =
  28.   match Env.find_value_by_name lid !Topcommon.toplevel_env with
  29.   | (path, desc) -> begin
  30.       (* Check if this is a primitive *)
  31.       match desc.val_kind with
  32.       | Val_prim _ ->
  33.           Format.fprintf ppf
  34.             "%a is an external function and cannot be traced.@."
  35.           Printtyp.longident lid
  36.       | _ ->
  37.           let clos = Toploop.eval_value_path !Topcommon.toplevel_env path in
  38.           (* Nothing to do if it's not a closure *)
  39.           if Obj.is_block clos
  40.           && (Obj.tag clos = Obj.closure_tag || Obj.tag clos = Obj.infix_tag)
  41.           && (match
  42.                 Types.get_desc
  43.                   (Ctype.expand_head !Topcommon.toplevel_env desc.val_type)
  44.               with Tarrow _ -> true | _ -> false)
  45.           then begin
  46.           match is_traced clos with
  47.           | Some opath ->
  48.               Format.fprintf ppf "%a is already traced (under the name %a).@."
  49.               Printtyp.path path
  50.               Printtyp.path opath
  51.           | None ->
  52.               (* Instrument the old closure *)
  53.               traced_functions :=
  54.                 { path = path;
  55.                   closure = clos;
  56.                   actual_code = get_code_pointer clos;
  57.                   instrumented_fun =
  58.                     instrument_closure
  59.                       !Topcommon.toplevel_env lid ppf desc.val_type }
  60.                 :: !traced_functions;
  61.               (* Redirect the code field of the closure to point
  62.                  to the instrumentation function *)
  63.               set_code_pointer clos tracing_function_ptr;
  64.               Format.fprintf ppf "%a is now traced.@." Printtyp.longident lid
  65.           end else
  66.             Format.fprintf ppf "%a is not a function.@." Printtyp.longident lid
  67.     end
  68.   | exception Not_found ->
  69.       Format.fprintf ppf "Unbound value %a.@." Printtyp.longident lid

  71. ‌let dir_untrace ppf lid =
  72.   match Env.find_value_by_name lid !Topcommon.toplevel_env with
  73.   | (path, _desc) ->
  74.       let rec remove = function
  75.       | [] ->
  76.           Format.fprintf ppf "%a was not traced.@." Printtyp.longident lid;
  77.           []
  78.       | f :: rem ->
  79.           if Path.same f.path path then begin
  80.             set_code_pointer f.closure f.actual_code;
  81.             Format.fprintf ppf "%a is no longer traced.@."
  82.               Printtyp.longident lid;
  83.             rem
  84.           end else f :: remove rem in
  85.       traced_functions := remove !traced_functions
  86.   | exception Not_found ->
  87.       Format.fprintf ppf "Unbound value %a.@." Printtyp.longident lid

  89. ‌let dir_untrace_all ppf () =
  90.   List.iter
  91.     (fun f ->
  92.       set_code_pointer f.closure f.actual_code;
  93.       Format.fprintf ppf "%a is no longer traced.@." Printtyp.path f.path)
  94.     !traced_functions;
  95.   traced_functions := []

  97. let _ = Topcommon.add_directive "trace"
  98.     (Directive_ident (dir_trace Format.std_formatter))
  99.     {
  100.       section = Topdirs.section_trace;
  101.       doc = "All calls to the function \
  102.           named function-name will be traced.";
  103.     }

  105. let _ = Topcommon.add_directive "untrace"
  106.     (Directive_ident (dir_untrace Format.std_formatter))
  107.     {
  108.       section = Topdirs.section_trace;
  109.       doc = "Stop tracing the given function.";
  110.     }

  112. let _ = Topcommon.add_directive "untrace_all"
  113.     (Directive_none (dir_untrace_all Format.std_formatter))
  114.     {
  115.       section = Topdirs.section_trace;
  116.       doc = "Stop tracing all functions traced so far.";
  117.     }


  120. (* --- *)


  123. let preload_objects = ref []

  125. (* Position of the first non expanded argument *)
  126. let first_nonexpanded_pos = ref 0

  128. let current = ref (!Arg.current)

  130. let argv = ref Sys.argv

  132. (* Test whether the option is part of a responsefile *)
  133. let is_expanded pos = pos < !first_nonexpanded_pos

  135. let expand_position pos len =
  136.   if pos < !first_nonexpanded_pos then
  137.     (* Shift the position *)
  138.     first_nonexpanded_pos := !first_nonexpanded_pos + len
  139.   else
  140.     (* New last position *)
  141.     first_nonexpanded_pos := pos + len + 2

  143. let prepare ppf =
  144.   Topcommon.set_paths ();
  145.   try
  146.     let res =
  147.       let objects =
  148.         List.rev (!preload_objects @ !Compenv.first_objfiles)
  149.       in
  150.       List.for_all (Topeval.load_file false ppf) objects
  151.     in
  152.     Topcommon.run_hooks Topcommon.Startup;
  153.     res
  154.   with x ->
  155.     try Location.report_exception ppf x; false
  156.     with x ->
  157.       Format.fprintf ppf "Uncaught exception: %s\n" (Printexc.to_string x);
  158.       false

  160. ‌let input_argument name =
  161.   let filename = Toploop.filename_of_input name in
  162.   let ppf = Format.err_formatter in
  163.   if Filename.check_suffix filename ".cmo"
  164.           || Filename.check_suffix filename ".cma"
  165.   then preload_objects := filename :: !preload_objects
  166.   else if is_expanded !current then begin
  167.     (* Script files are not allowed in expand options because otherwise the
  168.        check in override arguments may fail since the new argv can be larger
  169.        than the original argv.
  170.     *)
  171.     Printf.eprintf "For implementation reasons, the toplevel does not support\
  172.    \ having script files (here %S) inside expanded arguments passed through the\
  173.    \ -args{,0} command-line option.\n" filename;
  174.     raise (Compenv.Exit_with_status 2)
  175.   end else begin
  176.       let newargs = Array.sub !argv !current
  177.                               (Array.length !argv - !current)
  178.       in
  179.       Compenv.readenv ppf Before_link;
  180.       Compmisc.read_clflags_from_env ();
  181.       if prepare ppf && Toploop.run_script ppf name newargs
  182.       then raise (Compenv.Exit_with_status 0)
  183.       else raise (Compenv.Exit_with_status 2)
  184.     end

  186. ‌let file_argument x = input_argument (Toploop.File x)

  188. ‌let wrap_expand f s =
  189.   let start = !current in
  190.   let arr = f s in
  191.   expand_position start (Array.length arr);
  192.   arr

  194. module Options = Main_args.Make_bytetop_options (struct
  195.     include Main_args.Default.Topmain
  196.     let _stdin () = input_argument Toploop.Stdin
  197.     let _args = wrap_expand Arg.read_arg
  198.     let _args0 = wrap_expand Arg.read_arg0
  199. ‌    let anonymous s = file_argument s
  200.     let _eval s = input_argument (Toploop.String  s)
  201. end)

  203. ‌let main () =
  204.   let ppf = Format.err_formatter in
  205.   let program = "ocaml" in
  206.   let display_deprecated_script_alert =
  207.     Array.length !argv >= 2 && Topcommon.is_command_like_name !argv.(1)
  208.   in
  209.   Topcommon.update_search_path_from_env ();
  210.   Compenv.readenv ppf Before_args;
  211.   if display_deprecated_script_alert then
  212.     Location.deprecated_script_alert program;
  213.   Clflags.add_arguments __LOC__ Options.list;
  214.   Compenv.parse_arguments ~current argv file_argument program;
  215.   Compenv.readenv ppf Before_link;
  216.   Compmisc.read_clflags_from_env ();
  217.   if not (prepare ppf) then raise (Compenv.Exit_with_status 2);
  218.   Compmisc.init_path ();
  219.   Toploop.loop Format.std_formatter

  221. ‌let main () =
  222.   match main () with
  223.   | exception Compenv.Exit_with_status n -> n
  224.   | () -> 0
